page.title: 02 Wootton Parish Church.
page.content: The church is in the centre of Wootton on High Street. It has some features dating from the thirteenth century and it is thought that the tower was not originally part of the church and is older. The church is built of stone of varying colours and there is a weathercock at the top of the tower. The entrance is at the back because the north porch was demolished when High Street was improved. The first rector was Walter de Bidum who died in 1178. There are five bells, four of them dating back to the seventeenth century, and they have been rehung in an iron frame.The Saint George window is by William Morris.
